command.description: A command-line interface to Amazon's Simple Queue Service (SQS).

messages.message: Command "{$command}" is not valid. Try "sqs help".

command.name: create
command.description: Creates a new queue with the specified name. The queue may take up to 60 seconds to become available.

argument.name: queue_name
argument.description: The name of the queue to create.

command.name: delete
command.description: Deletes an existing queue by the specified URI. The queue may take up to 60 seconds to become unavailable.

argument.name: queue_uri
argument.description: The URI of the queue to delete.

command.name: help
command.description: Displays an overview of available options and commands, or detailed help for a specific command.

argument.name: command
argument.description: An optional command name for which to get detailed help.

command.name: list
command.description: Lists available queues. If a prefix is specified, only queues beginning with the specified prefix are listed.

argument.name: prefix
argument.description: An optional prefix of the queues to list.

command.name: send
command.description: Sends input from STDIN to the specified queue. The resulting message identifier is displayed on STDOUT.

argument.name: queue_uri
argument.description: The URI of the queue to which the message is sent.

command.name: receive
command.description: Receives a message from the specified queue. The message body is displayed on STDOUT. If no message is received, nothing is displayed on STDOUT.

option.name: delete
option.description: Deletes the message after receiveing it.

option.name: timeout
option.description: Sets the visibility timeout for the received message.

argument.name: queue_uri
argument.description: The URI of the queue from which the message is received.
